com.github.koshamo.fiddler

Interface EventHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FiddlerFxApp

    public interface EventHandler
    A module that wants to register to the message bus to receive messages or notifications needs to implement this interface.

    As soon as any module sends a message to the message bus, it will be distributed to all EventHandlers registered to the message bus, depending on the registration policy. The distribution mechanism calls the method handle(Event event), which then can implement the reaction to this message.

    Example: 

     
 public class StrBoolDataEvent extends  DataEvent<String, Boolean> {
                public StrBoolDataEvent(EventHandler source, EventHandler target, String meta, Boolean data) {
                        super(source, target, meta, data);
                }
 }

 public MyClass implements EventHandler {
                 @Override
                public void handle(Event event) {
                        if (event instanceof StrBoolDataEvent) {
                                StrBoolDataEvent de = (StrBoolDataEvent) event;
                                if (de.getMetaInformation().equals("KEY_ONE"))
                                        doActionOne();
                                if (de.getMetaInformation().equals("KEY_TWO"))
                                        doActionTwo();
                        }
                }
 }
    If any module sends an ExitEvent to the message bus, the message bus calls the method shutdown() on every registered module. Thus every module must implement the shutdown() method and may implement some special code to safely shut this module down, e.g. save data, stop threads etc.
    Author:
    Dr. Jochen Ra√üler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle(Event event)
      this method handles incoming events from the message bus.
      void shutdown()
      this method is called, as soon as any module sends an ExitEvent to the message bus.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        void handle(Event event)
        this method handles incoming events from the message bus.

        choose whatever messages may be of interest for you and implement how to react to this message.

        Parameters:
        event - the event that is distributed by the message bus

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        this method is called, as soon as any module sends an ExitEvent to the message bus.

        This method is something like a destructor for your current module, so you may write some clean up code to safely shut your module down and do what needs to be done before the module exits.
